name: Military Might
title: High Armed Forces Personnel
description: In 2020, Eritrea had 13.36% of its total labor force in the armed forces, showcasing a significant military presence relative to its population.

name: Aid Deficit
title: Negative Net Bilateral Aid from Switzerland
description: In 2022, Eritrea experienced a negative net bilateral aid flow from Switzerland amounting to -$100,000, indicating a financial outflow rather than support.

name: Business Blues
title: Low Business Regulatory Environment Rating
description: Eritrea's business regulatory environment was rated 1 out of 6 in 2023, reflecting significant challenges for business operations.

name: Financial Fumbles
title: Poor Financial Management and Sector Ratings
description: In 2023, Eritrea scored 1 out of 6 in both budgetary and financial management and financial sector ratings, indicating inefficiencies and challenges.

name: Revenue Roadblocks
title: Low Efficiency in Revenue Mobilization
description: Eritrea's revenue mobilization efficiency was rated 2 out of 6 in 2023, highlighting difficulties in generating government revenue.

name: Trade Troubles
title: Low Trade Rating
description: With a trade rating of 1.5 out of 6 in 2023, Eritrea faces significant barriers in international trade.

name: Transparency Trials
title: Low Transparency and Accountability Rating
description: In 2023, Eritrea's public sector transparency and accountability were rated 1 out of 6, indicating high levels of corruption.

name: Data Dilemma
title: Poor Data Infrastructure
description: Eritrea's data infrastructure scored 10 out of 100 in 2023, reflecting significant challenges in statistical performance.

name: Internet Isolation
title: Minimal Secure Internet Servers
description: In 2023, Eritrea had only 1 secure internet server, equating to 0.29 per million people, indicating limited digital infrastructure.

name: Logistics Lag
title: Low Logistics Performance
description: In 2018, Eritrea's logistics performance index for timely shipments was 2.08 out of 5, suggesting inefficiencies in delivery systems.

name: Regulatory Ruts
title: Low Regulatory Quality
description: Eritrea's regulatory quality was in the 0.47 percentile rank in 2023, indicating weak governance and regulatory frameworks.

name: Sanitation Struggles
title: High Open Defecation Rates
description: In 2016, 88.65% of Eritrea's rural population practiced open defecation, with 67% of the total population affected, highlighting severe sanitation issues.
